SUMMARY: During anaerobiosis, TdcA participates in controlling genes (tdc operon) involved in transport and metabolism of threonine and serine [8413189, 11251844, 7928991]. TdcA belongs to LysR family of transcriptional regulators, and like or members of this family, it has a helix-turn-helix motif in N-terminal domain for DNA binding [8413189]. Although interaction between TdcA and regulatory region of tdc operon has not been demonstrated, it has been suggested that TdcA recognizes and binds to an inverted repeat located upstream of operon [7928991]. tdcA is first gene in tdcABCDEFG operon, which is autoactivated by TdcA. This operon is divergently transcribed with tdcR gene, whose product also activates transcription of operon [2573820]. TdcA probably interacts with TdcR to activate transcription [7928991] and y appear to function toger with CRP and IHF, proteins that bend DNA, for this activation [11251844]. A mutation in tdcA gene of enterohemorrhagic Escherichia coli O157:H7 causes expression of OmpA protein which is involved, among several or processes, in cellular adherence [12933841]. tdc: threonine dehydratase [6327641].
